The `google_drive_mount` Ansible role and `mount_google_drive.yml` playbook have been created to automate the mounting of a user's Google Drive to `~/gDrive`.
=== Role: `google_drive_mount` === This role performs the following actions: * Installs the `rclone` package. * Creates the `~/gDrive` mount point. * Deploys a pre-configured `rclone.conf` file to `~/.config/rclone/rclone.conf`. * Deploys a systemd user service file to `~/.config/systemd/user/gdrive-rclone.service` to make the mount persistent. * Enables and starts the systemd user service.
=== Playbook: `mount_google_drive.yml` === This playbook applies the `google_drive_mount` role to the `[desktops]` group, targeting the `will` user.
=== Usage === To apply the Google Drive mount to a desktop, ensure the host is in the `[desktops]` group in the `inventory.ini` file, and then run: `ansible-playbook playbooks/mount_google_drive.yml -i inventory.ini --limit `
The playbook has been successfully tested on `venus`.
